content.question: Mannerist works differed from works of the Northern Renaissance such as Massysâ€™ Madonna and Child in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Mannerist works mostly avoided religious subjects, while Northern Renaissance works were mainly focused on religious subjects.
Northern Renaissance works rejected classical style and subjects, while Mannerist works sought to duplicate classical works.
While both Mannerist and Northern Renaissance works depicted religious subjects, Northern Renaissance works placed more emphasis on human-centered naturalism.
While both Mannerist and Northern Renaissance works used illusion and distortion, Northern Renaissance works mostly rejected humanist themes.

content.answer: While both Mannerist and Northern Renaissance works depicted religious subjects, Northern Renaissance works placed more emphasis on human-centered naturalism.
